episodeTitle: Vs. Wapol's Corps! The Power of the Munch Munch Fruit!
episodeTitleJapanese: VSワポル軍団！バクバクの実の能力！
episodeTitleRomanized: VS Wapol Gundan! Bakubaku no Mi no Nouryoku!
description: Wapol attacks Drum Castle and attempts to destroy Dr. Hiriluk's flag. Luffy and Sanji defend the symbol while Wapol demonstrates the full power of his Baku Baku no Mi by fusing his subordinates into Chessmarimo.

events.title: Wapol Attacks Hiriluk's Flag
events.description: Wapol arrives at Drum Castle and begins firing cannonballs at Dr. Hiriluk's Jolly Roger flag, which stands atop the castle as a memorial. This attack provokes Luffy and Sanji to defend the flag.
events.significance: Establishes the central conflict of the episode and demonstrates the ideological importance of the pirate flag within One Piece's narrative. Wapol's attack on this memorial shows his complete disrespect for the late doctor.

quotes.text: That flag is a symbol of faith and a pledge to risk one's life!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy explains why he's protecting Hiriluk's flag

events.title: Luffy Uses Gomu Gomu no Pistol on Wapol
events.description: Luffy punches Wapol with his signature Gomu Gomu no Pistol, sending him flying off the castle. However, Wapol is rescued by his subordinates before falling down the mountain.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's protective nature regarding symbols of faith and beliefs, even when he doesn't personally know Hiriluk.

events.title: Kuromarimo's Static Afro Attack
events.description: Kuromarimo throws afros at Sanji that stick to him by static electricity. Though they seem harmless, Chess later fires incendiary arrows that ignite the afros, creating a dangerous fire trap.
events.significance: Introduces a comedic yet tactical combat strategy unique to Kuromarimo's fighting style.

events.title: Baku Baku Factory Revealed
events.description: Wapol demonstrates the advanced capability of his Baku Baku no Mi (Munch Munch Fruit) by transforming into 'Baku Baku Factory' - a house-like form that allows him to fuse things he's eaten together to create new combinations.
events.significance: First demonstration of the Baku Baku Factory technique, showcasing the Devil Fruit's ability to combine consumed objects and living beings. This is a major reveal of the fruit's true potential beyond simple consumption.

quotes.text: Behold the power of my Baku Baku Factory!
quotes.speaker: Wapol
quotes.context: Wapol announces his technique before fusing his subordinates

events.title: Chessmarimo's Debut
events.description: Wapol uses his Baku Baku Factory to eat both Chess and Kuromarimo, then fuses them together to create Chessmarimo - a combined warrior with four arms and the abilities of both subordinates.
events.significance: First appearance of Chessmarimo, demonstrating the horrifying implications of the Baku Baku no Mi's fusion ability. Shows Wapol's willingness to sacrifice his subordinates' individuality for combat advantage.

quotes.speaker: Chessmarimo
quotes.context: Chessmarimo's first words after being created

events.title: Chopper vs. Chessmarimo Battle Begins
events.description: Chopper engages in combat with the newly-created Chessmarimo. This is one of Chopper's first significant solo battles as he defends the castle and his mentor's legacy.
events.significance: Important character development moment for Chopper, who must face a powerful fused opponent. Shows Chopper stepping up to protect what matters to him.

events.title: Chessmarimo's Yukidoke no Ya Marimo
events.description: Chessmarimo uses his four arms to fire two giant burning arrows simultaneously at his opponents, demonstrating the combined combat capabilities of Chess and Kuromarimo.
events.significance: Shows the tactical advantage of having four arms in combat, as Chessmarimo can wield multiple weapons simultaneously.

events.title: Chopper Defeats Chessmarimo with Kokutei Roseo
events.description: Using the skills enhanced by his Rumble Ball transformation, Chopper identifies Chess's chin as a weak point through his Brain Point ability and defeats Chessmarimo with his Kokutei Roseo (Kokutei Cross) technique.
events.significance: Marks Chopper's first major solo victory in the series, demonstrating his combat effectiveness and strategic thinking. Shows the importance of his various transformation forms.

events.title: Wapol Shoots Down Hiriluk's Flag
events.description: After Chessmarimo's defeat, Wapol fires another cannonball directly at Dr. Hiriluk's Jolly Roger, successfully shooting it down from the top of Drum Castle.
events.significance: This is the emotional climax of the episode, as the symbol that Chopper and the island holds dear appears to be destroyed. It represents Wapol's contempt for everything Hiriluk stood for.

events.title: Luffy Catches and Raises Hiriluk's Flag
events.description: Luffy catches Dr. Hiriluk's falling flag and, using one of the sleeves from Nami's coat, raises it back atop the castle. When Wapol shoots it again, Luffy doesn't flinch, protecting the flag with his body and letting it continue to wave.
events.significance: This is one of the most powerful symbolic moments in the Drum Island arc. Luffy's unwavering protection of the flag exemplifies the series' themes about the importance of inherited will, symbols of faith, and the courage to protect what others believe in. Even though Luffy didn't know Hiriluk personally, he understands the importance of what the flag represents.

quotes.text: Although I don't know who this flag belongs to, it is a symbol of life that no one should play around with!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's declaration as he protects Hiriluk's flag with his body

quotes.text: That flag is a symbol of faith and a pledge to risk one's life!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Explaining why he's protecting Hiriluk's flag

themes.description: The episode powerfully explores how symbols and beliefs outlive their creators. Luffy protects Hiriluk's flag not because he knew the doctor, but because he understands the importance of what it represents - a person's faith and dreams.
themes.symbolism: The Jolly Roger flag represents Hiriluk's unwavering belief in freedom and hope. Its resilience in the face of Wapol's attacks symbolizes how ideas and dreams cannot be destroyed by force.
culturalReferences: The concept of inherited will (受け継がれる意志) is a core theme throughout One Piece

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the power of symbols to represent beliefs and ideals worth fighting for. The flag is not just cloth - it represents everything Hiriluk stood for and believed in.
themes.symbolism: Luffy standing in front of the cannonballs to protect the flag demonstrates that some things are worth taking damage to protect, even if you don't fully understand their history.

themes.description: Wapol's willingness to fuse his own subordinates shows his corrupt view of others as mere tools, contrasting sharply with the Straw Hats' view of crew as family.
themes.symbolism: The fusion of Chess and Kuromarimo into Chessmarimo represents the loss of individual identity for the sake of power.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his deep understanding of the importance of symbols and inherited will. Even without knowing Hiriluk, he recognizes the flag's significance and protects it with his body.
keyActions: Punches Wapol with Gomu Gomu no Pistol
Raises the flag again using Nami's coat sleeve
Takes cannonball hits to protect the flag
quotes: That flag is a symbol of faith and a pledge to risk one's life!

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper fights to protect his mentor's memory and legacy. His victory over Chessmarimo represents his growth as both a fighter and as someone carrying on Hiriluk's will.
keyActions: Uses Brain Point to identify weakness

characterSpotlights.development: Wapol reveals the full extent of his Devil Fruit powers and his complete disregard for others, even his own subordinates. His attack on the flag shows his contempt for everything Hiriluk represented.

Shoots down the flag multiple times
quotes: Behold the power of my Baku Baku Factory!

characterSpotlights.development: Chessmarimo debuts as a demonstration of the Baku Baku no Mi's horrifying fusion ability. Despite having four arms and combined abilities, he is defeated by Chopper's strategic fighting.
keyActions: Created through Baku Baku Factory fusion
Fights Chopper with four-armed combat style
Uses Yukidoke no Ya Marimo technique

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended some of the combat sequences between Chopper and Chessmarimo for dramatic effect.
The anime added more reaction shots of various characters watching the flag defense.

trivia.fact: Episode 87 had a TV rating of 14.8%, ranking 6th in viewership for its timeslot in Japan.
Chessmarimo is the first fusion character created by a Devil Fruit ability in the One Piece anime series.
The scene where Luffy protects Hiriluk's flag is considered one of the most iconic symbolic moments in the Drum Island arc, representing the series' themes of inherited will.
The English dub title 'Defending the Flag' (4Kids version) more directly references the episode's central theme compared to the Japanese title which focuses on the Devil Fruit ability.
This episode covers material from manga chapters 145-148, showing significant pacing with multiple chapters adapted.
